entry.title: Up to 325,000 live in areas potentially threatened by Cotopaxi volcano in Ecuador
entry.summary: President Rafael Correa decreed prior censorship Saturday on the volcano, worrying press freedom groups.

entry.title: About 325,000 live in shadow of Ecuador's Cotopaxi volcano
entry.summary: The volcano began showing renewed activity in April.

entry.title: About 425,000 live in shadow of Ecuador's Cotopaxi volcano
entry.summary: QUITO, Ecuador (AP) " Ecuadorean authorities said Monday that up to 325,000 people live in areas that could be threatened by fast-moving mud and rock flows if there is a major eruption of the Cotopaxi volcano.

entry.title: Ecuador declares emergency as volcano near capital spews ash
entry.summary:
President Rafael Correa declared a state of emergency Saturday over increasing activity in the Cotopaxi volcano near the capital of Quito, and officials evacuated a few hundred people as a precaution.

Presidential legal secretary Alexis Mera said further ash explosions and some pyroclastic flows on the volcano's western slopes Saturday led officials to evacuate some nearby villages.

Four blasts inside the volcano sent ash shooting more than two miles in the sky Friday, coating highways, homes and cars just south of Ecuador's capital with a fine gray powder.

entry.title: Ecuador evacuation after increased activity around Cotopaxi volcano
entry.summary: The president of Ecuador has declared a state of emergency after the giant Cotopaxi volcano showed signs of increased activity.

entry.title: Snow-capped Cotopaxi volcano spews ash south of Ecuador's capital
entry.summary:
Government scientists said the 5,987-meter (19,600-foot) snow-capped volcano doesn't seem to be on the verge of a major eruption.

"The situation merits the population staying informed about what's happening with the volcano," said Ramon.

entry.title: Ecuador's Cotopaxi volcano spews ash south of Quito
entry.summary: The volcano is 30 miles (50 kilometers) from Quito.

entry.title: Ecuador's Cotopaxi volcano spews ash south of Quito
entry.summary: A volcano has spewed ash over a wide area in two pre-dawn blasts near Ecuador's capital.

entry.title: Highly active volcano erupts on Reunion amid media frenzy
entry.summary:
Lava erupts from the Piton de la Fournaise "Peak of the Furnace" volcano, on the southeastern corner of the Indian Ocean island of Reunion Saturday, Aug. 1, 2015.

The volcano is in the Reunion National Park - a world heritage site.

entry.title: â€‹Ancient volcano tattooed the Earth with giant rings
entry.summary:
Tectonic activity, or the movement of continental plates, eventually drifted the volcano away from its hot spot, so Pilanesberg is now dormant, according to NASA Earth Observatory.

The Ossipee ring dike formed around 90 million years ago, during the second of three major eruptions throughout the active period of the volcano that created the structure.

entry.title: Volcano-like underground fire is put out after a month
